comments:
I20070501-0010

* No matter what JRE is specified by a launch config, ths system default VM is always launched from Eclipse when debugging/running a target application.

> Removing the JAVA_JVM_VERSION environment variable allows to launch alternate VMs
My system default is a 1.5 VM. With this workaround I can debug on 1.6 VMs, but not on 1.4.2.

I get the following exception trying to debug on 1.4.2:

java.net.SocketException: Socket closed
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketAccept(Native Method)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.accept(PlainSocketImpl.java:384)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.implAccept(ServerSocket.java:450)
	at java.net.ServerSocket.accept(ServerSocket.java:421)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportService.accept(SocketTransportService.java:95)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketTransportImpl.accept(SocketTransportImpl.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.SocketListeningConnectorImpl.accept(SocketListeningConnectorImpl.java:135)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.launching.StandardVMDebugger$ConnectRunnable.run(StandardVMDebugger.java:83)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:613)

Created an attachment (id=65532)
patch

Sets the JAVA_JVM_VERSION environment variable to the VM being launched before launching.

Created an attachment (id=65540)
patch

even better... test suite revealed NPE on Mac. Fixed.
Please verify, Mike. (Also requires fix from bug 126729).

Modified fix for next build. Was not quite working... a "break;" was in the wrong place, so we only modified the env var if it happened to be the first one. Also, in the case the config specified no environment, we were not replacing it properly. Please verify.
*** Bug 186276 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Re-opening. We still launch the wrong VM in run mode (we only prepend the path for debug mode).

patch for run

fixes up the StandardVMRunner
